title: Provides that sentence for commission of certain provisions of murder in the first degree is death or life without parole
summary: Provides that the sentence for committing murder in the first degree when the victim is a police officer, peace officer or correction officer shall be either death or life imprisonment without parole.

    1  MURDER IN THE FIRST DEGREE AS DEFINED  IN  SUBPARAGRAPH  (I),  (II),  OR

   54  parole  shall  not  be  or  become  eligible  for  parole or conditional

    1  nate sentence.  A defendant may be sentenced to life imprisonment  with-
    2  out  parole  upon conviction for the crime of murder in the first degree
    3  as defined in section 125.27 of this chapter and in accordance with  the
    4  procedures  provided  by  law  for imposing a sentence for such crime. A
    5  defendant must be sentenced to life  imprisonment  without  parole  upon

    8  class  A-I felony; the crime of criminal possession of a chemical weapon

   15  section  125.27  of this chapter.  A defendant must be sentenced to life
   16  imprisonment without parole upon conviction for the crime of  murder  in
   17  the  second  degree  as defined in subdivision five of section 125.25 of
   18  this chapter or for the crime of aggravated murder as defined in  subdi-
   19  vision  one  of  section  125.26  of  this  chapter.  A defendant may be
   20  sentenced to life imprisonment without parole upon  conviction  for  the
   21  crime  of  aggravated  murder  as  defined in subdivision two of section

   24  SION  ONE OF SECTION 125.27 OF THIS CHAPTER AND THE SENTENCE OF DEATH IS
   25  NOT IMPOSED.
   26    S 4. Subdivisions 1 and 10 of section 400.27 of the criminal procedure
   27  law, as added by chapter 1 of the laws of 1995, are amended to  read  as
   28  follows:
   29    1.  Upon  [the] conviction of a defendant for the offense of murder in
   30  the first degree as defined by SUBPARAGRAPH (I), (II) OR (III) OF  PARA-
   31  GRAPH  (A)  OF  SUBDIVISION  ONE OF section 125.27 of the penal law, the
   32  court shall promptly conduct a separate sentencing proceeding to  deter-

   35  the penal law. Nothing in this section shall be deemed to  preclude  the
   36  people  at any time from determining that the death penalty shall not be

   39  defendant to life imprisonment without  parole  [or  to  a  sentence  of
   40  imprisonment  for  the  class  A-I  felony of murder in the first degree
   41  other than a sentence of life imprisonment without parole].
   42    10. (A) At the conclusion of all the  evidence,  the  people  and  the
   43  defendant  may present argument in summation for or against the sentence
   44  sought by the people. The people may deliver the first summation and the
   45  defendant may then deliver the last  summation.  Thereafter,  the  court
   46  shall  deliver  a  charge  to the jury on any matters appropriate in the
   47  circumstances. In its charge, the court must instruct the jury that with
   48  respect to each count of murder in  the  first  degree,  AS  DEFINED  IN
   49  SUBPARAGRAPH  (I),  (II) OR (III) OF PARAGRAPH (A) OF SUBDIVISION ONE OF

   51  a sentence of death should be imposed and whether or not a  sentence  of
   52  life  imprisonment  without parole should be imposed[, and that the jury

   54  instruct  the  jury  that in the event the jury fails to reach unanimous
   55  agreement with respect to the sentence,  the  court  will  sentence  the

    1  ty  and  twenty-five  years  and  a  maximum term of life. Following the
    2  court's charge, the jury shall retire to consider  the  sentence  to  be

    6    (B)  THE  COURT MUST INSTRUCT THE JURY THAT THE JURY MUST BE UNANIMOUS

   11    (C)  FOLLOWING  THE  COURT'S CHARGE, THE JURY SHALL RETIRE TO CONSIDER

   13  THIS  SECTION,  THE  PROVISIONS OF SECTIONS 310.10, 310.20 AND 310.30 OF

   15    S 5. This act  shall  take  effect  immediately  and  shall  apply  to
   16  offenses committed on or after such effective date.
